name: TapSimple
description:
TapSimple provides unique fundraising products designed for charities to quickly respond to the contactless revolution - a combination of custom fundraising software and affordable hardware, informed by extensive market research. 

Our first product allows fundraisers and volunteers to simply collect donations through their phone or tablet.

jobs.title: Part Time Financial Controller
jobs.description:
TapSimple

Financial Controller – Part Time - London

Overview:
TapSimple are hiring a part time Financial Controller for a growing charity focused technology company as it evolves from ‘early growth’ to ‘scale up’ phase. The Financial Controller will be the first formal hire in Finance and will work on a part time basis of 2 to 3 days a week. The role will report directly to senior management.

Job Purpose:

Responsible for the efforts and results of the company’s financial department. 

Financial Controller Job Duties:

•	Oversee all company accounts and investments
•	Create monthly and annual management reports to identify results, trends, and inform financial forecasts
•	Create weekly cash flow forecast and manage cash flow and regularly review internal reports
•	Suggest updates and improvements for accounting systems and software, including payroll and invoicing
•	Ensure that all financial transactions are properly recorded, filed, and reported
•	Establish and implement financial reporting systems to comply with government regulations and legislation
•	Establish robust internal controls to ensure appropriate use and accounting for company resources 
•	Collaborate with external accounting/ auditing services to comply with all statutory financial reporting obligations. 
•	Collaborate with external tax advisors to manage VAT, Corporation Tax and PAYE obligations. Management of R&D tax claims.
•	Manage accounts receivable and accounts payable. 
•	Review all financial plans and budgets regularly to look for cost reduction opportunities

Financial Controller Skills and Qualifications:

•	Bachelor's degree or master's degree in accounting, business, economics, finance, or a related field
•	Working towards a recognised accounting qualification. Qualified accountant (ACA, ACCA, CIMA or equivalent) preferable.
•	Minimum 3yrs of relevant experience, preferably in a start-up environment 
•	Experience in a software company
•	Demonstrable expertise in the use of Microsoft Excel
•	Knowledge of the Xero accounting package preferable.
•	Multi-tasking
•	Interpersonal skills 
•	Outstanding mathematical skills
•	Honesty
•	Integrity
•	Reliability
•	Solid written and verbal communication skills
•	High attention to detail 
•	Organisational skills 
•	Critical thinking and problem-solving skills 
•	Research skills
•	Analytical skills
•	Computer skills
•	Understanding of data privacy standards
